title: Drawing, "Design for a Ewer with Spout and Loop Handle", 1600–50
medium: Graphite, red crayon, pen and ink, brush and gray-brown watercolor on laid paper
inscribed: Verso: inscribed in pen: [...] insieme la circolare.; lower left: sup fine d'un cono tagliato.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Seen from the front, with loop having a horizontal direction. A mask below the spout. The alternative suggestions refer to the loop and have or omit a female gaine and suggest different kinds of scrolls. Verso: shows geometrical figures with explanations in pen.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Ewer with Spout and Loop Handle", 1600–50.
1600–50. Graphite, red crayon, pen and ink, brush and gray-brown watercolor on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7413.
